title: Does TikTok Send Notifications if You Screen Record Videos?

steps.title: No—TikTok won't send notifications if you screenshot or screen record a video.
steps.content: No—TikTok won't send notifications if you screenshot or screen record a video. You can screen record a TikTok video using your iPhone, iPad , or Android without needing to worry about the video creator knowing. If you want to screen-record in clear mode, long-press a TikTok video in the app and tap Clear mode . This will remove the video information and interaction icons.

steps.title: Open the TikTok app.
steps.content: Open the TikTok app. This looks like a multi-colored music note with a black background. Log in if you haven't already. [1] X Research source TikTok is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . This method will only work using the mobile app. The creator of the TikTok must also allow downloads.

steps.title: Find a video.
steps.content: Find a video. By default, your For You will open. Swipe up to view new videos until you find one you want to save.

steps.title: Tap the "Share" icon.
steps.content: Tap the "Share" icon. This is the right-pointing arrow below the bookmark icon. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Save video.
steps.content: Tap Save video . This can be found in the bottom row of icons, between Not interested and Turn off captions . If you do not see this option, the creator does not allow downloads for their video.

steps.title: Locate your video.
steps.content: Locate your video. The saved video can be found in your Camera Roll (iOS) or Gallery (Android).

steps.title: Open the TikTok app.
steps.content: Open the TikTok app. This looks like a music note with a black background. Log in if you haven't already. If needed, you can install TikTok or create an account . Use this method to turn off video downloads for your own posted TikToks. This will not stop users from screen-recording your videos.

steps.title: Tap Profile.
steps.content: Tap Profile . This will be at the bottom-right corner, next to a person icon. Your profile page will open. This is where you can edit your TikTok profile .

steps.title: Tap ☰ on the top right corner.
steps.content: Tap ☰ on the top right corner. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Settings and privacy.
steps.content: Tap Settings and privacy . A new page will open.

steps.title: Tap Privacy.
steps.content: Tap Privacy . This will be underneath Account .

steps.title: Tap Downloads.
steps.content: Tap Downloads . You can find this underneath the Interactions header.

steps.title: Toggle off "Video downloads".
steps.content: Toggle off "Video downloads". This will stop other TikTok users from downloading your videos to their devices. If you want your videos completely private, you'll need to switch to a private account. You can do this by going to Settings and privacy → Privacy → toggle on Private account .
